alert.note: Alert for Eddy (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 7:40AM MDT until August 28 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River near Artesia 6E affecting Eddy County. .Thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall have produced abundant rainfall on the Pecos watershed upstream of Artesia. The Pecos River at Artesia is expected to rise into flood over the next couple of days, dependent on a flood wave coming downstream from Lake Arthur. For the Pecos River...including Artesia 6E...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pecos River near Artesia 6E. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, the river reaches bankfull. Overbank flooding occurs about 1/2 mile upstream from the gage and spreads onto the flood plain. As a result, river width increases to approximately 1 mile in some reaches. Minor flooding of low-lying areas occurs, but no significant damage is expected. At 12.5 feet, the river reaches minor flood stage. Structures at Wilbank Trucking, Inc., located approximately 1/4 mile east of the gage, begin to flood. At 13.5 feet, the river reaches the floor of the instrument shelter. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday morning to a crest of 12.7 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 07/18/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (feet): Fld Observed Thu Fri Fri Sat Location Stg Stg Day/Time 12pm 12am 12pm 12am Pecos River Artesia 6E 12.5 9.9 Thu 7am 10.1 10.6 11.2 11.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 745 PM MDT.
